column4: hi how do i know the current permission of a file in 'numbers'? such as 777, 750, etc? :D
permissions are r w x (read, write, execute), r = 4, w = 2, x = 1.  See also: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/FilePermissions
It is.  But there's no real reason to do so.
maybe he could copy the default config file, rename that new file, and do a2dissite and a2ensite?
